citations.narrative:
Multiple areas of the facility are not constructed in a manner to protect the animals from injury as follows:
• The self-guided drive-thru safari park contains multiple holiday light decorations illuminated during the "Safari of Lights"
evening operating hours of 5 pm to 9 pm nightly from December 13 – December 29, 2024. There are live electrical cords
and generators powering the holiday light structures in the enclosures with covered species.
• In the walkabout petting zoo area, in the llama outdoor primary enclosure containing five llamas, live electrical cords are
present on the ground powering lights on the trees and barn within the enclosure as well as lights on the enclosure. There
are live electrical cords running through the middle of their primary enclosure.
Unsecured and unprotected electrical cords within reach of the animals can cause entanglement, injury, or possibly
electrocution. The housing facilities must be maintained to protect the animals from injury.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
Lisa Ekman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a)  Repeat
   
Facilities, general. 
Multiple areas of the facility are not constructed in a manner to protect the animals from injury as follows: 
• The self-guided drive-thru safari park contains multiple holiday light decorations illuminated during the "Safari of Lights" 
evening operating hours of 5 pm to 9 pm nightly from December 13 – December 29, 2024. There are live electrical cords 
and generators powering the holiday light structures in the enclosures with covered species.  
• In the walkabout petting zoo area, in the llama outdoor primary enclosure containing five llamas, live electrical cords are 
present on the ground powering lights on the trees and barn within the enclosure as well as lights on the enclosure. There 
are live electrical cords running through the middle of their primary enclosure.  
Unsecured and unprotected electrical cords within reach of the animals can cause entanglement, injury, or possibly 
electrocution. The housing facilities must be maintained to protect the animals from injury. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Lisa Ekman, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
